main event: A bright light, brighter than Venus, was observed in Greenfield, Iowa on September 16, 1968.
interesting points: The light appeared to move rapidly and could disappear and reappear in the same spot., The sighting lasted approximately 10 seconds., The object was estimated to be the size of a small light source., The conclusion leaning towards it being an aircraft., The observer reported seeing no sound from the object.
witness description: The observer was knowledgeable about astronomy and recognized the light as unusual compared to nearby stars.
